response.message:
Isn't there something in Pulp Fiction about flexing GIMP muscles?

Uuuurrgh.

This is a fantastic service, thank you Stack Overflow.

I just have one problem with it: The top voted ads are for products that we all already know about and love. That's why they keep getting voted up.

Maybe the engine could toss in the "not so highly voted" ads randomly so I don't have to see ads for products I use every day?

@Frank Krueger: How will the lack of votes differentiate between a lesser-known product and a poor ad? The solution is to vote on the products you want to see supported. Go out and evangelize the products you would like to publicize and encourage others to vote for more deserving products.
@Robert Cartino - good point ... but should this ('poor ad') be about the quality of the advert?
+1 for mentioning the GIMP - no wait, this isn't StackOverflow.
[Paint.Net](http://www.getpaint.net/) is a great alternative to GIMP.
nice voting, this vote for open source for network only?
@Bevan: we don't *need* an alternative to the GIMP. It does everything. (Well, it doesn't make coffee.)
